Sentencas: Semiconductor ionic electrolytes are attracting growing interest for developing low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (LT-SOFCs).
Titulo: Enhancing the Performance of the p-n Heterostructure Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells via A-Site-Deficiency Engineering

Sentencas: Our recent study has proposed a p-n heterostructure electrolyte based on perovskite oxide BaCo0.4Fe0.4Zr0.1Y0.1O3-delta (BCFZY) and ZnO, achieving promising fuel cell performance.
Titulo: Enhancing the Performance of the p-n Heterostructure Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells via A-Site-Deficiency Engineering

Sentencas: Herein, to further improve the performance of the heterostructure electrolyte, an A-site-deficiency strategy is used to solely modify BCFZY for regulating the ionic conduction and catalytic activity of the heterostructure.
Titulo: Enhancing the Performance of the p-n Heterostructure Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells via A-Site-Deficiency Engineering

Sentencas: Two new electrolytes, B(0.9)CFZY-ZnO and B(0.8)CFZY-ZnO, were developed and systematically studied.
Titulo: Enhancing the Performance of the p-n Heterostructure Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells via A-Site-Deficiency Engineering

Sentencas: The results show that the two samples gain improved ionic conductivity and auxiliary catalytic activity after A-site deficiency as a result of the increment of the surface and interface oxygen vacancies.
Titulo: Enhancing the Performance of the p-n Heterostructure Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells via A-Site-Deficiency Engineering

Sentencas: The single cells with B(0.9)CFZY-ZnO and B(0.8)CFZY-ZnO exhibit enhanced peak power outputs at 450-550 degrees C compared to the cell based on B(1.0)CFZY-ZnO (typically, 745 and 795 vs 542 mW cm(-2) at 550 degrees C).
Titulo: Enhancing the Performance of the p-n Heterostructure Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells via A-Site-Deficiency Engineering

Sentencas: Particular attention is paid to the impact of A-site deficiency on the interface energy band alignment between B(x)CFZY and ZnO, which suggests that the p-n heterojunction effect of B(x)CFZY-ZnO for charge carrier regulation can be tuned by A-site deficiency to enable high proton transport while avoiding fuel cell current leakage.
Titulo: Enhancing the Performance of the p-n Heterostructure Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells via A-Site-Deficiency Engineering

Sentencas: This study thus confirms the feasibility of A-site-deficiency engineering to optimize the performance of the heterostructure electrolyte for developing LT-SOFCs.
Titulo: Enhancing the Performance of the p-n Heterostructure Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells via A-Site-Deficiency Engineering
